contentList.content: *You return to the world, coughing violently, feeling drained...*
contentList.comment: *You return to the world, coughing violently. You feel drained, but thankfully, the Meistr has a Source fountain in her basement...*
contentList.content:
Meistr Siva instructs me to record my research before I conduct any experiments regarding Godwoken ascension.

The ritual itself is quite simple.

1) Place a single piece of blackroot in the ritual bowl.

2) Draw blood with obsidian lance (your own is most convenient) and sprinkle it upon the root.

3) Set a flame to the bowl and its contents.

4) Ensure that you have sufficient Source.

5) Inhale the resulting smoke.

6) Beyond this point, nothing is known.
The ingredients for this ritual are not rare per se, but may be difficult to procure. The Meistr's Source fountain never runs low, though the Source inside appears corrupt. Blackroot, however, is another matter entirely.

The root grows in the forests to the north-west of Driftwood. It produces no poison or thorns to guard it, but all manner of creatures stalk those trees. It is wise to quickly grab what one needs and then return.

I pray that my experiments here pave the way for future scholars. Or, should I succeed, to allow any to be the equals of Godwoken.

-Apprentice Talich
contentList.comment:
Meistr Siva instructs me to record my research before I conduct any experiments regarding Godwoken ascension.

The ritual itself is quite simple.

1) Place a single piece of blackroot in the ritual bowl.

2) Draw blood with obsidian lance (your own is most convenient) and sprinkle it upon the root.

3) Set a flame to the bowl and its contents.

4) Ensure that you have sufficient Source.

5) Inhale the resulting smoke.

6) Beyond this point, nothing is known.
The ingredients for this ritual are not rare per se, but may be difficult to procure. I am fortunate that the Meistr's Source fountain never runs low, so it is simple to gather Source. Blackroot, however, is another matter entirely.

The root grows in the forests to the north-west of Driftwood. It produces no poison or thorns to guard it, but all manner of creatures stalk those trees. It is wise to quickly grab what one needs and then return.

I pray that my experiments here pave the way for future scholars. Or, should I succeed, to allow any to be the equals of Godwoken.

-Apprentice Talich
contentList.content: The ritual was a failure as we were not infused with Source. We should make use of the Source fountain in Meistr Siva's cellar, and try the ritual once more.
contentList.comment: The ritual was a failure as we were not infused with Source. We should make use of the Source fountain in Meistr Siva's cellar, and try the ritual once more.
contentList.content: Gain 3 Action Point(s) immediately, but lose 5 Action Point(s) next turn.
contentList.comment: Gain 2 Action Point(s) immediately, but lose 2 Action Point(s) next turn.
contentList.content: Summon is bonded to it's master.
contentList.comment: Vitality, Damage, Physical Armour and Magical Armour increased by Summoning ability of the master.
contentList.content: Damage is based on your level and receives bonus from Might.
Damage is based on your basic attack and receives a bonus from Might.
Reduces the damage from bludgeoning attacks.
Reduces the damage from bludgeoning attacks.
Damage is based on your current Armor Rating.
A medium-sized potion that enchants and strengthens your Armor.
Armor Rating reduces the damage of Physical damage directly.
A large-sized potion that enchants and strengthens your Armor.
A very large-sized potion that enchants and strengthens your Armor.
A potion that enchants and strengthens your Armor.

Speed improves your Action Points, Movement Speed, Deflection, as well as your Thievery.

1 point adds 0.1 Movement and 1% Deflection.
+1 Thievery at 13, 17, 22, 28, and 35 points and +1 Action Points per turn at 15, 24, and 35 points.
A large-sized, thick, and cloudy drink that sharpens the Speed of the drinker.
A relic of a bygone era, this book once taught valuable skills to the aspiring ranger or huntsman. Maybe I should hold onto this?
A medium-sized, thick, and cloudy drink that sharpens the Speed of the drinker.
A relic of a bygone era, this book once taught valuable skills to aspiring thieves and scoundrels. Maybe I should hold onto this?
A thick, cloudy drink that sharpens the Speed of the drinker.
A relic of a bygone era, this book once taught valuable skills to aspiring thieves and scoundrels. Maybe I should hold onto this?
Determines your AP, Speed, and Dodge.
Increases damage you deal and how much you can carry
A relic of a bygone era, this book once taught valuable skills to aspiring martial artists and warriors. Maybe I should hold onto this?
A relic of a bygone era, this book once taught valuable skills to aspiring martial artists and warriors. Maybe I should hold onto this?
A relic of a bygone era, this book once taught valuable skills to aspiring martial artists and warriors. Maybe I should hold onto this?

Might increases all damage you deal and allows you to use heavier weapons and carry heavier items.

1 point adds 5% damage.
A relic of a bygone era, this book once taught valuable skills to the aspiring geomancer. Maybe I should hold onto this?
Find somewhere that offers Aptitude brews, then add this monkfish sample. The effects could be most interesting...
Find somewhere that peddles Aptitude herb mixes, then add the monkfish that I gave you - the effects of the new mixture could be quite interesting...

Aptitude improves the strength of statuses you apply.

1 point adds 5% status strength to tiered statuses you apply.
A relic of a bygone era, this book once taught valuable skills to aspiring witches and necromancers. Maybe I should hold onto this?
A relic of a bygone era, this book once taught valuable skills to the aspiring pyrokinetic. Maybe I should hold onto this?
[1] gives you 2 bonus points in [2], but you lose a point in Aptitude.
[1] gives you [2] to Physique and +[3] to Perception.
This medium-sized potion smells faintly of old books and is capable of boosting your Aptitude.
This large-sized potion smells faintly of old books and is capable of boosting your Aptitude.
Now this monkfish, one that's been touched by the Void itself... who's to say how its flesh could augment an Aptitude brew? It could prove to be most valuable...
[1] gives you [2] to Physique and +[3] to Aptitude.
A relic of a bygone era, this book once taught valuable skills to the aspiring aerotheurge. Maybe I should hold onto this?
A relic of a bygone era, this book once taught valuable skills to the aspiring aerotheurge. Maybe I should hold onto this?
A relic of a bygone era, this book once taught valuable skills to the aspiring hydrosophist. Maybe I should hold onto this?
A relic of a bygone era, this book once taught valuable skills to the aspiring polymorph. Maybe I should hold onto this?
A relic of a bygone era, this book once taught valuable skills to the aspiring polymorph. Maybe I should hold onto this?
A relic of a bygone era, this book once taught valuable skills to the aspiring summoner. Maybe I should hold onto this?
A relic of a bygone era, this book once taught valuable skills to the aspiring summoner. Maybe I should hold onto this?
This potion smells faintly of old books and is capable of boosting your Aptitude.

Wisdom improves your Healing, Fire, Air, and Water Resistances, as well as your Maximum AP, Loremaster, Willpower, and Maximum Elemental Resistances.

1 point adds 3% Healing, and 1% Fire, Air, and Water Resistances.
+1 Maximum AP, Loremaster, Willpower, and +1% Maximum Elemental Resistances at 13, 17, 22, 28, and 35 points. Gain 1 Memory Slot per 2 points.
[1] gives you [2] extra points in your Wisdom attribute.

Perception improves your Critical Chance, Range, Accuracy, and your ability to detect traps and find hidden treasures, as well as your Initiative and Sneaking.

1 point adds 1.5% Critical Chance, 0.15 Meter Range, and 2% Accuracy.
+1 Initiative and +1 Sneaking at 13, 17, 22, 28, and 35 points.
[1] gives you [2] to Physique and +[3] to Perception.
High Perception allows for detection of the extraordinary

Something hidden has been revealed! The higher your <font color="008858">Perception</font>, the more likely you are to reveal <font color="008858">traps</font> and <font color="008858">secrets</font>.
[1] gives you a +[2] Perception bonus to detecting traps.

Physique determines how much Vitality you have and improves your Armor Rating, Bludgeoning, and Poison resistance, as well as your Grit and Maximum Poison Resistance, and is required to wear heavy armor.

1 point adds 7% Vitality, 1% Armor Rating, and 1% Poison and Bludeoning Resistance.
+1 Grit and +1% Maximum Poison and Bludgeoning Resistance at 13, 17, 22, 28, and 35 points.

Duration: 2 turns
Might: [2]
Speed: [3]
Aptitude: [4]
Physique: [5]
Wisdom: [6]
Memory: [7]
Damage dealt depends on your weapon's damage rating.
A medium-sized potion that fortifies your physique by scrubbing your insides from top to bottom.
A small-sized potion that fortifies your physique by scrubbing your insides from top to bottom.
A large-sized potion that fortifies your physique by scrubbing your insides from top to bottom.
A vile-scented draught capable of draining your physique.

Mixing Notes


Experimentation has been improving recently, thanks to the large numbers of “willing” customers down here in the Undertavern

I’ve tried every combination of herbs I can think of down here. Many sent them into fever dreams and manic rampages, but there were a few mixtures that stood out as being quite useful - perhaps useful enough to win me the Herbmaster’s Pestle next year in Arx!

Courage:
Drudanae & Farhangite
Increases physique

Ferocity:
Drudanae & Augmentor
Increases productivity

Alertness:
Drudanae & Puffball
Increases perception

Enlightenment:
Drudanae & Calocera
Increases aptitude


[Her notes continue into a frankly horrifically graphic rendition of experiments she made into dramatically extending the effects using Void-tainted fish.]
Be warned though - there's an opportunity cost in self-improvement. What you gain in physique will likely be lost from elsewhere. Aptitude, I would assume.
But be warned; equal mastery in all skills is nigh on impossible. This lesson in perception will require a sacrifice - a degree of your physique.
[1] gives you [2] to Physique and +[3] to Might.
Gain 1 Action Point immediately and a [2]% damage boost for 2 turns at the cost of [1] Physique. Any Action Points over your maximum are lost.
This bottle, containing a medium-sized potion capable of granting Willpower to its drinker, seems to jump within your hand.
This bottle, containing a large-sized potion capable of granting Willpower to its drinker, seems to jump within your hand.
This bottle, containing a potion capable of granting Willpower to its drinker, seems to jump within your hand.
Grit reduces the strength of Grit statuses applied against you by 25% per point multiplicatively. Additionally, your tough attitude makes people sell stuff to you 1% cheaper.

Willpower reduces the strength of Willpower statuses applied against you by 25% per point multiplicatively. Additionally allows you to move items up to 4 meters per point telepathically regardless of weight.

Skills focusing on supporting allies and cleansing surfaces.


Level 1: Cleanse, Safeguard
Level 2: Consecrate
Level 3: Illuminate, Cleanse C2, Smite
Level 4: Bless, Safeguard C2, Revivify
Level 5: Cleanse C3, Smite C2, Telestic Bolt
Level 6: Fracture, Intertwine
Level 7: Twist Fate, Divine Armor, Smite C3
Level 8: Condemn, Restore
Level 9: Bless C2
Level 10: Divine Favor, Crucify

Level 5: Elemental Bastion, Bolster C2, Crippling Blow, Weakening Strike C3

Level 8: Stifle

Level 5: Cloak and Dagger, Sawtooth Knife

Level 7: Ghost Form, Corrupted Blade
Level 8: Premeditate, Corrupted Blade C2
Level 9: Daggers Drawn
Level 10: Bladestorm, Daggers Drawn C2

Level 1: Electric Discharge, Shocking Touch
Level 2: Teleport
Level 3: Thunderjump, Electric Discharge C2, Guiding Winds, Pressure Spike
Level 4: Cyclone
Level 5: Dazing Bolt, Electric Discharge C3, Make Invisible
Level 6: Pressure Spike C2, Netherswap
Level 7: Chain Lightning, Rending Gale, Tornado
Level 8: Dazing Bolt C2, Superconductor, Make Invisible C2
Level 10: Chain Lightning C2, Thunderstorm, Protection Bubble

Level 4: Tremor, Fossil Strike C2, Oily Blob
Level 5: Acid Dart C3, Create Oil C2, Impalement, Vineyard

Level 7: Petrifying Gaze, Acid Spores, Earthquake, Create Oil C3
Level 8: Devastate
Level 10: Petrifying Gaze C2, Acid Spores C2, Mountain Aegis, Sand Coffin

Level 1: Ricochet, Pinning Stance
Level 2: First Aid

Level 4: Glitter Dust, Ricochet C2, Quickshot Stance
Level 5: Barrage, Power Stance, First Aid C2

Freeze your enemies and heal your allies to keep the tide of battle in your favor.

Level 1: Malediction, Mosquito Swarm
Level 2: Lower Resistances

Level 10: Blight Curse, Soul Sap
Allows empowering an additional skill with Source and grants a free Attribute point with every point invested.

Skills focusing on area-of-effect damage and strong buffs.


Level 1: Searing Daggers, Heat Metal

Level 7: Infectious Flame, Fire Whip, Terrible Flame

Level 9: Fire Whip C2
Level 10: Meteor Shower, Fire Whip C3
Required for the usage of Specialist skills.
Specialist skills are determined by Specialist talents, of which you may only take one.

Skills focusing on healing and freezing targets.


Level 1: Rain, Freeze
Level 2: Regenerate
Level 3: Deluge, Ice Spike, Armor of Frost, Freeze C2
Level 4: Lethal Torrent, Regenerate C2
Level 5: Healing Ritual, Ice Spike C2, Global Cooling, Flash Freeze, Freeze C3

Level 7: Ice Spike C3, Icebreaker, Lethal Torrent C2, Mass Heal
Level 8: Horrid Wilting
Level 9: Winter Blast C2
Level 10: Hailstorm, Blizzard

Skills focusing on close quarters damage and single-target crowd control.


Level 1: Cleave, Anticipation
Level 2: Pumping Iron
Level 3: Defensive Stance, Whirlwind, Throw
Level 4: Cleave C2, Anticipation C2, Harrying Stance, Pumping Iron C2
Level 5: Grapple, Ironhide, Forward Stance
Level 6: Enrage, Pumping Iron C3, Whirlwind C2, Throw C2
Level 7: Grapple C2, Indomitable, Disembowel, Onslaught
Level 8: Leap
Level 9: Grapple C3, Disembowel C2
Level 10: Thick Of The Fight, Crush, Disembowel C3

Weal bestows good fortune upon you. Additionally increases your Lucky Charm by 1 every 2 points and Critical Chance by 2% per point.

Gain a 20% chance per point in Weal to gain a random buff every turn. Chance above 100% can grant multiple buffs. Buff quality is determined by your Weal, with more powerful buffs being unlocked at higher levels.

Leadership grants bonuses to nearby allies which are doubled on summons, and grants the leader +1 Initiative per point. Leadership is active up to 10 meters, increased by 1 meter per point of Leadership. Incapacitated characters cannot provide leadership. Additionally, levels past the third grant the leader the buff as if it were three levels down.

Level 1: Increase damage, chance to hit.
Level 2: Increase Critical Chance.
Level 4: Increase Resistances and Armor.
Level 6: Increase Movement, Willpower.
Level 8: Increase Grit.
Level 10: Increase AP.
Magic Armor is disabled in DCO.
For yourself and nearby allies, Deflection is increased by 90% and Movement Speed is increased by 1m.
Deflection and movement speed increased for allies around you.
[1] gives you +[2]% maximum Vitality and +[3]% Deflection.
Target character's Deflection is increased by 90% and Movement Speed is increased by 20%.
Increased resistances, Accuracy, Deflection. Protects against Diseased, Decaying, Petrified, Stunned.
Deflection: -10% per each adjacent enemy beyond the first.
[1] removes the Deflection penalty when flanked.
Remove [2] from enemies around you and set Deaf, reducing Wits, Accuracy and Deflection.

Allows usage of heavier armor. Provides bonuses to your weapon depending on what you are wielding.

Two-Handed: Critical Chance +4%, Critical Damage +5%, Damage +7.5%.
Single-Handed: Accuracy +5%, Critical Damage +3%, Damage +5%.
Dual-Wielding: Critical Damage +5%, Damage +3%. Cost of attacking is reduced by 1 at level 4 and 2 at level 10.
Bow: Accuracy +4%, Critical Damage +5%, Damage +10%.
Crossbow: Critical Chance +4%, Critical Damage +5%, Damage +6%.
Staff: Critical Damage +10%, Damage +5%. Aptitude +1 per 2 points.
Wand: Critical Chance +2%, Damage +5%. Aptitude +1 per 3 points per weapon.
Shield: Deflection +3%, Maximum Resistances 1% per two points.
[1] immediately gives you [2] extra Combat ability points.
contentList.comment: Immune to [1] // Immune to bludgeoning damage
contentList.content: (Options locked while all three are selected)
The stats of summons depend on caster level.
contentList.comment: The stats of the summons will depend on caster level and [1] ability.
contentList.content:
Tier I (1): Character doesn't know where they're going.
Tier II (2-3): Where is this guy going?
Tier III (4-7): Character seems like they could hit anyone.
Tier IV (8): Character doesn't know friend from foe.

Tier I (1): -10% Dodge, -3 Maximum AP, +20% Movement Speed Reduction.
Tier II (2-3): -20% Dodge, -4 Maximum AP, +30% Movement Speed Reduction.
Tier III (4-7): -30% Dodge, -6 Maximum AP, +50% Movement Speed Reduction.
Tier IV (8): Miss Turn, -100% Dodge. Immune to many effects.
contentList.comment: Character is turned to stone. Cured by Magic Shell, Bless.
contentList.content: Paralysed by electricity. Can be cured by Magic Shell, Bless.
Character is charmed and has switched sides.

Tier I (1): -25% Deflection.
Tier II (2-3): -15% Accuracy, -1 AP, -35% Deflection.
Tier III (4-7): -25% Accuracy, -2 AP, -50% Deflection.
Tier IV (8): Miss turn, -100% Deflection.
Staggered lasts one turn.
[1] immediately gives you [2] extra Combat ability points.
contentList.comment: [1] immediately gives you [2] extra Combat ability point(s) and [3] extra Civil ability point(s).
contentList.content: Any Leadership auras affecting you act as if they are 1 level higher, including your own.
Any Leadership auras affecting you act as if they are 1 level higher, including your own.
[1] reduces the cost of using grenades and scrolls by [2] AP when your offhand is free. Swapping Weapons and Equipment refunds 1 AP.
contentList.comment: [1] reduces the cost of using grenades and scrolls by [2] AP when your offhand is free.
contentList.content: Recover 33% of the Arrows, Scrolls, and Grenades you use. Arrows, Scrolls, and Grenades that you use gain +25% Strength for their status application. Grenades deal +25% Damage, additively to Might.
contentList.comment: [1] gives you [2]% chance to recover a special arrow after shooting it.
contentList.content: [1] immediately grants you [2] extra attribute points to spend.
contentList.comment: [1] immediately grants you [2] extra attribute point to spend.
contentList.content: Once per combat, instead of dying, your health is temporarily increased by 40%. When your next turn comes around, the bonus is lost. If you die and are resurrected in combat, [1] will be available again.
contentList.comment: Once per combat, if an enemy lands a fatal blow, [1] will help you bounce back to life with [2]% health. If you die and are resurrected in combat, [1] will be available again.
contentList.content: [1] lets you evade attacks of opportunity. Resist Movement Speed Reduction affecting you by up to 50% points.
contentList.comment: [1] lets you evade attacks of opportunity.
contentList.content: [1] lowers the Action Point cost of spells by [2] when standing in a surface of the same element.
contentList.comment: [1] lowers the Action Point cost of spells by [2] when standing in a surface of the same element.
contentList.content: Standing in a surface gives you 15% resistance to its element. Melee weapons gain elemental damage depending on the surface you are standing in. Arrows gain elemental damage depending on the surface your target is standing in.
contentList.comment: Shooting arrows will inflict bonus elemental damage depending on the surface your target is standing in.
contentList.content: Automatically attack enemies who suffer strength 4 or higher Slowed, Crippled, or Staggered on their turn up to 5m away if you are not Invisible or Sneaking. Can only trigger once per turn. Allows you to flee combat even if enemies are right next to you.
contentList.comment: [1] allows you to flee combat even when enemies are right next to you.
contentList.content: [1] gives you 2 extra Action Points and 20% of your maximum vitality after dealing a killing blow to an enemy, or 1 AP and 10% maximum vitality if they are further than 5m. Can trigger once per turn.
contentList.comment: [1] gives you [2] extra Action Points after dealing a killing blow once per turn.
contentList.content: [1] increases the range of skills and scrolls by [2]m. Does not affect melee and touch-range skills. Aptitude raised by 3 while no enemies are within 5m of you while in combat.
contentList.comment: [1] increases the range of skills and scrolls by [2]m. Does not affect melee and touch-range skills.
contentList.content: Gain +15% damage, +20% Deflection, immunity to Fear, Charmed, Mad and Silenced, and +1 AP per turn while drunk on top of its original effects, but it only lasts 1 turn. Effects of food and potions are doubled.
contentList.comment: [1] doubles the effects of food and potions.
contentList.content: You start every combat round with Maximum AP. All resistances and armor reduced by 40%. Grit and Willpower reduced by 3 (to a minimum of 0).
contentList.comment: With [1], you start every combat round with Maximum AP, but Magic and Physical Armour do not protect you from statuses.
contentList.content: While sneaking, [1] increases attack damage by [2]%. Reduces cost of entering sneak mode by [3] AP. After successfully sneaking, you cannot be spotted while there are less than 2 enemies within 7m, increased by 1 for every ally within 7m who is not invisible, sneaking, or incapacitated.
contentList.comment: While sneaking, [1] increases attack damage by [2]%. Also reduces cost of entering sneak mode by [3] AP.
contentList.content: Gain 15% fire resistance and 10% maximum fire resistance. Applying Burning to a target with Burning IV will apply Necrofire. Gain immunity to Burning.
contentList.comment: While you are at maximum Vitality, [1] grants you an extra [2]% critical chance and [3]% more accuracy!
contentList.content:
Kingsman makes enemies prefer targetting you. Effect increases the closer you are to them.
Ghastly makes you less noticeable to attackers.

A character with Kingsman gains 1% Resistances per point in Knight, and 1% Maximum Resistances per 2 points.

Ghastly reduces your health by 15%, but you gain permanent Spirit Vision and a buff dependent on the amount of Source you have:
0 Source: -10% Damage
1 Source: +5% Damage
2 Source: +10% Damage
3 Source: +15% Damage, Immunity to Fear, can cast a Source skill for free every 5th round
contentList.comment: A character with [1] has an extra [2]% [3], but takes a [4]% penalty to [5]. Additionally, the maximum [3] is raised by [6].
contentList.content: A character with [1] gains 20% Lifesteal and is healed when standing in blood, consuming the surface.
contentList.comment: [1] heals you when standing in blood.
contentList.content: Living Armor stores damage dealt to you, and when healed, stored damage is converted at 25% efficiency into resistance to the damaging element for 2 turns. Physical damage is converted into an armor boost.
contentList.comment: [1] adds [2]% of all healing you receive by skills or consumables to your Magic Armour.
contentList.content: Lone Wolf provides +2 Max AP, +2 Recovery AP, +25% Vitality, +25% Physical Armour, and doubles invested points in attributes and combat abilities, with the exception of Source Mastery, while you are adventuring solo or with at most one companion. This bonus is temporarily removed while there are more than two members in the current party.
contentList.comment: [1] provides +[2] Max AP, +[3] Recovery AP, +[4]% Vitality, +[5]% Physical Armour, +[6]% Magic Armour, and doubles invested points in attributes - up to a maximum of 40 - and combat abilities (except Polymorph ability) - up to a maximum of 10 - while you are adventuring solo or with at most one companion. This bonus is temporarily removed while there are more than two members in the current party.
contentList.content: [1] gives you [2] extra points in your Wisdom attribute and your healing is an additional 35% better.
contentList.comment: [1] gives you [2] extra points in your Memory attribute.
contentList.content: Allows you to have two summons at once, but summons not covered by your Leadership Aura die. When resurrected, you resurrect to full health and don't suffer Resurrection Fatigue.
contentList.comment: When resurrected, you resurrect to full health.
contentList.content: [1] gives you the ability to perform attacks of opportunity.
contentList.comment: [1] gives you the ability to perform attacks of opportunity.
contentList.content: Deflection is raised by 10%, or 20% while dual wielding. Automatically attack anyone who is deflected by you within 5m if you are able, you do not have Shields Up, and it is not your turn.
contentList.comment: [1] gives you [2]% Dodging while dual wielding.
contentList.content:
[1] enables you to talk to animals.

You can swap this for another talent, but you wouldn't do that, right?
contentList.comment: [1] enables you to talk to animals.
contentList.content: [1] gives you [2]% bonus Vitality per point in Warrior, and up to 10% Critical Chance and Accuracy while above 90% vitality.
contentList.comment: [1] gives you extra Vitality: +[2]% for every point in Warfare.
contentList.content:
[1] gives all magical skills a critical chance equal to your critical chance score. Become Muted while not carrying a Staff or Wand, and immunity to Muted otherwise. Your Damage and Might Effectiveness are reduced by 25%. Air, Fire, Water, and Poison gain unique statuses on critical hits. Can only apply one status to a character at a time.

Critical Hits with Air apply Flow, lowering the the target's Willpower by 1.
Critical Hits with Fire apply Seared, lowering the target's Fire Resistance by 25%.
Critical Hts with Water apply Rime, increasing Movement Speed Reduction by 50% and reducing Deflection by 25%.
Critical Hits with Poison apply Toxicity, a stacking -15% Poison Resistance debuff. At 5 stacks, their Grit is reduced by 1.
contentList.comment: [1] gives all magical skills a critical chance equal to your critical chance score.
contentList.content:
[1] gives all magical skills a critical chance equal to [2]% of your critical chance score. Become Muted while not carrying a Staff or Wand, and immunity to Muted otherwise. Your Damage and Might Effectiveness are reduced by 25%. Air, Fire, Water, and Poison gain unique effects on critical hits. Can only apply one status to a character at a time.

Critical Hits with Air apply Flow, lowering the the target's Willpower by 1.
Critical Hits with Fire apply Seared, lowering the target's Fire Resistance by 25%.
Critical Hts with Water apply Rime, increasing Movement Speed Reduction by 50% and reducing Deflection by 25%.
Critical Hits with Poison apply Toxicity, a stacking -15% Poison Resistance debuff. At 5 stacks, their Grit is reduced by 1.
contentList.comment: [1] gives all magical skills a critical chance equal to [2]% of your critical chance score.
contentList.content:
[1] makes your attacks no longer miss and Physical and Bludgeoning damage you deal apply unique statuses, but your Critical Chance is reduced by 100%. Additionally adds an extra [2]m range to your grenade throws.

Bludgeoning damage applies a stacking Dazed debuff, increasing their Movement Speed Reduction by 20% up to 100%.
Physical damage applies Wrought, reducing their Physical Resistance by 10%.
contentList.comment: [1] adds an extra [2]m range to your grenade throws.
contentList.content: [1] everyone's attitude towards you is reduced by 25, but you no longer affected by Flanking debuffs, count as two people for Flanking, and enemies within 5m get +25% Movement Speed Reduction.
contentList.comment: [1] decreases everyone's attitude towards you by [2], but melee opponents find you less attractive in combat.
contentList.content: [1] permits your character [2] AP worth of free movement per turn.
contentList.comment: [1] permits your character [2] AP worth of free movement per turn.
contentList.content: Critical Hits increase the Strength of any statuses applied by 100%. Your Critical Chance goes up by 1% every time you deal non-critical damage from any source, resetting on a successful critical hit. Your Damage and Might Effectiveness are reduced by 10%.
contentList.comment: With [1], certain statuses caused by you are no longer blocked by Magic or Physical Armour, and their duration is extended by one turn. Burning, Poisoned, Bleeding, Necrofire, Acid, Suffocating, Entangled, Death Wish, and Ruptured Tendons are affected by this talent.
contentList.content: [1] makes you explode in a bloody cloud when you die, dealing [2]% of your Vitality as physical damage in a [3] meter radius. Additionally you gain 25% damage reflection as Piercing.
contentList.comment: [1] makes you explode in a bloody cloud when you die, dealing [2]% of your Vitality as physical damage in a [3] meter radius.
contentList.content: [1] reduces all status durations by 1 turn, including positive statuses. Does not affect statuses with a duration of 1 turn.
contentList.comment: [1] reduces all status durations by 1 turn, including positive statuses. Does not affect statuses with a duration of 1 turn.
contentList.content: [1] increases your recovery and maximum Action Points by 1 at or below 66% health, and 2 at or below 33%. Your damage is increased by up to 50% depending on how much health you are missing.
contentList.comment: [1] increases your recovery and maximum Action Points by [2] when your health is below [3]%.
Applies Slowed, ignoring Magic Armour, adds a chance to explode on movement.
Applies Chill and Chance of Frozen.
contentList.content: Applies Fortified (3). Cleanses Shocked and Petrified.
contentList.comment: Applies Fortified, Cleanses Stun and Petrified.
Applies Decaying, causing characters to take damage when healed.
Chance of Magic Shell, which increases Magic Armour.
contentList.content: Unallocated points may be spent in-game. Skills will be granted automatically from your abilities.
contentList.comment: You still have points to spend! Points can also be spent later, in-game. Continue?
